details.content:
More cadres flooding the crowd outside the hospital and ant-line of party functionaries getting in and out of the hospital, which is the first time in the past two days after M Karunanithi was hospitalized. @NewIndianXpress #Karunanidhi #KarunanidhiHealth #DMK #KauveryHospital pic.twitter.com/zJlmA5V7xH

— Sahaya Novinston Lobo (@SahayaNovinston) July 29, 2018

District secretaries and state functionaries of the party flooding the hospital. M Karunanithi's grand children arriving one after another. #Karunanidhi #KauveryHospital @NewIndianXpress

— Sahaya Novinston Lobo (@SahayaNovinston) July 29, 2018
An empty ambulance has arrived. This is the first time since his admission at the hospital that an an ambulance is let in through the main entrance.

Hundreds of DMK supporters have gathered outside Chennai's Kauvery Hospital, where DMK Chief M Karunanidhi is admitted.
Express photos | Ashwin Prasath. pic.twitter.com/s1BafDezZ6

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 29, 2018

details.title: Kauvery Hospital releases bulletin: says Karunanidhi's vitals are improving
details.content:
Latest medical bulletin on Kalaignar @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/FIAelbnkLR

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) July 29, 2018
All outsiders have been expelled from the hospital premises. (TV reports)
New set of barricades placed outside the hospital as crowds become restless
Party members are trying to breach into the hospital
K Anbazhagan, DMK general secretary and longtime colleague of Karunanidhi arrives at the hospital.
Loud speakers are brought outside the hospital. DMK functionaries are addressing the crowd, appealing them to stay calm.

details.title: Karunanidhi's health is improving after a setback, says A Raja
details.content:
Former Union Minister A Raja says after a setback in the health condition of Karunanidhi and he is improving. He asks DMK cadre not to believe believe rumours @NewIndianXpress

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) July 29, 2018
Former Union minister A Raja appeals to DMK cadre to disperse; crowd less frenzied after release of health bulletin.

details.title: Police lathicharge unruly mob
details.content:
A few party cadres turn unruly by throwing barricades. Police begin lathicharging.

#WATCH: Outside visuals of Chennai's Kauvery hospital, where DMK Chief M Karunanidhi is admitted. Police lathi charge crowd gathered outside. #TamilNadu pic.twitter.com/3fkR0LFlb1

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2018
Karunanidhi's family members leave the hospital, including son MK Stalin
Police make slight lathi charge to the people who were standing outside kauvery hospital.(Express Photo | Ashwin Prasath)
Karunanidhi's son MK Alagiri tells the media his father is fine; asks if the family would leave if his situation wasn't better.
Karunanidhi's daughter MK Kanimozhi, leaving the hospital, tells media he's "much better".

details.title: MK Stalin requests for calm in press release
details.content:
MK Stalin in his press release said: There was a setback in our beloved party chief's health and he is doing better as the doctors continue to treat him. I request all the party cadres to maintain peace and cooperate with the police on duty.

MK Stalin requests party pic.twitter.com/HyKkl2GliM

— Sahaya Novinston Lobo (@SahayaNovinston) July 29, 2018

Restive DMK @arivalayam cadre chanting slogans, leader come out strongly, outside #KauveryHospital @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/KStrDl5Qff

— Sivakumar_TNIE (@sivakumarie) July 29, 2018
A person seen hurt during the scuffle between police and public. (Express Photo | Ashwin Prasath)
A person seen hurt during the scuffle between police and public. (Express Photo | Ashwin Prasath)

#DMK cadre relentless even as clock inches toward 1 am. Come down @kalaignar89 , this man shouts. #KarunanidhiHealth #KauveryHospital #Karunanidhi @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/cutTuvn4xk

— Samuel Merigala (@themerigala) July 29, 2018
Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami reaches Chennai after cutting his Coimbatore trip short.
Commissioner of Police A.K. Viswanathan arrives at Kauvery Hospital to check security preparedness.
